IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: THE MOORE CENTER SERVES PEOPLE WITH INTELLECTUAL, DEVELOPMENTAL AND PERSONAL CHALLENGES BY CREATING OPPORTUNITIES FOR A GOOD LIFE.
IRS990.MissionDesc: THE MOORE CENTER SERVES PEOPLE WITH INTELLECTUAL, DEVELOPMENTAL AND PERSONAL CHALLENGES BY CREATING OPPORTUNITIES FOR A GOOD LIFE.
IRS990.Desc: RESIDENTIAL SERVICES - PROVISION OF HOUSING (APARTMENTS AND STAFFED RESIDENCES) TO CLIENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: DAY SERVICES - PROVISION OF JOB ORIENTED HABILITATION SERVICES TO CLIENTS

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: FAMILY DIRECTED SERVICES - GENERALLY FOR CLIENTS WHO ARE LIVING AT HOME, WHERE PARENTS OR GUARDIANS ARE SEEKING TO DEFINE AND MANAGE SERVICES TO THE CLIENT. PROVIDES FUNDING FOR SUPPORTIVE SERVICES INCLUDING STAFF IN HOME, DAY PROGRAMS EITHER AT HOME OR AT A VENDOR, CLIENT THERAPIES, AND OTHER SERVICES THAT ARE DETERMINED TO BE NEEDED BY PARENTS. ALL SERVICES MUST MEET MEDICAID GUIDELINES FOR ELIGIBILITY.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: SERVICE COORDINATION SERVICES - CASE MANAGEMENT ACTIVITIES PROVIDED (E.G. SERVICE COORDINATION, ADVOCACY, FACILITATION AND MONITORING).

SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HOLDS CLIENT FUNDS, PASS-THROUGH FUNDS HELD FOR OTHERS RESTRICTED TO PAYMENTS FOR SERVICES. THE FUNDS ARE ONLY HELD FOR OTHERS AND ARE NOT THE PROPERTY OF MOORE CENTER SERVICES, INC.
THE FUNDS ARE INTENDED TO BE USED IN A MANNER CONSISTENT WITH THE ORGANIZATION'S MISSION.

FIN 48 FOOTNOTE: MANAGEMENT RECOGNIZES THE TAX BENEFIT OF AN UNCERTAIN TAX POSITION ONLY IF MANAGEMENT DETERMINES THAT IT IS MORE LIKELY THAN NOT THAT THE TAX POSITION WOULD BE SUSTAINED UPON EXAMINATION BY TAXING AUTHORITIES BASED ON THE TECHNICAL MERIT OF THE POSITION. MANAGEMENT HAS DETERMINED THAT THROUGH JUNE 30, 2018, THEY HAVE NOT TAKEN ANY TAX POSITIONS WHICH DO NOT MEET THE CRITERIA FOR RECOGNITION.
ORGANIZATION AGREED TO PAY THE EMPLOYEES' FICA TAX OBLIGATIONS RELATED TO DEFERRED COMPENSATION EARNED BY ITS SENIOR MANAGEMENT EMPLOYEES.
THE ORGANIZATION DOES NOT HAVE WRITTEN POLICY. PAYMENTS ARE MADE IN ACCORDANCE WITH EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE'S INSTRUCTIONS/APPROVAL.
FOUR OF THE FIVE OFFICERS LISTED IN PART VII, LINE 1A PARTICIPATE IN A SUPPLEMENTAL NONQUALIFIED RETIREMENT PLAN. NO CONTRIBUTIONS WERE MADE TO THE PLAN FOR THE YEAR.

IssuerName.BusinessNameLine1Txt: NH HEALTH AND EDUCATION FACILITIES AUTHORITY

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: FINANCE BUILDING PURCHASE AND RELATED CAPITAL IMPROVEMENTS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PREPARER PROVIDES DRAFT OF FORM 990 TO MANAGEMENT FOR REVIEW. ONCE FORM 990 HAS BEEN APPROVED BY MANAGEMENT, A DRAFT IS FORWARDED TO THE GOVERNING BODY FOR THEIR REVIEW.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE POLICY IS INCLUDED IN EMPLOYEE MANUAL. SHOULD AN ISSUE OF CONFLICT OR THE APPEARANCE OF A CONFLICT BECOME EVIDENT, THE EMPLOYEE MAY BE ASKED TO SEVER THE RELATIONSHIP. EMPLOYEES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCUSS POSSIBLE CONFLICTS WITH THEIR MANAGER. NOT DOING SO, COULD RESULT IN DISCIPLINARY ACTION, UP TO AND INCLUDING TERMINATION.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE OF THE BOARD IS RESPONSIBLE FOR EVALUATING THE PERFORMANCE OF THE CEO AND SETTING HIS/HER COMPENSATION. THIS IS DONE ON AN ANNUAL BASIS. IN SETTING COMPENSATION THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE MAY REFER TO EXTERNAL INFORMATION SUCH AS SALARY SURVEYS OR COMPENSATION STUDIES TO ASSIST IN THEIR DECISION-MAKING. DECISIONS ARE REFLECTED IN MINUTES OF THE MEETING AND ARE IMPLEMENTED THROUGH THE STAFF ACTION PROCESS BY THE CFO AS DIRECTED BY THE BOARD CHAIR/CHAIR OF THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION MAKES ITS GOVERNING DOCUMENTS, CONFLICT OF INTEREST POLICY, AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS AVAILABLE TO THE PUBLIC UPON REQUEST.
UNREALIZED GAIN ON INTEREST RATE SWAP 181,391.
NO CHANGE FROM PRIOR YEAR IN THE PROCESS OF OVERSEEING THE FINANCIAL STATEMENT AUDIT AND THE SELECTION OF THE INDEPENDENT AUDITOR.
THE ORGANIZATION DID NOT RECEIVE THESE TYPES OF CONTRIBUTIONS
